text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to show
you how to make a coconut berry baked
oatmeal it's fantastic it's so so good
you're going to love it you can eat it
all week long for breakfast or snack in
life in my case with some yogurt and
it's really amazing it comes together in
no time at all but it really is so good
let me run you through the list of
ingredients what I have here are some
old-fashioned oats you do not want
instant oats in this for this recipe
I've got some flaked unsweetened coconut
I've got some chopped up walnuts you can
use any nut you like I've got baking
powder salt ground cinnamon what I have
here is some vanilla coconut almond milk
you can use mixture it's unclean though
I've got some I'm maple syrup you can
also use honey I've got an egg some more
coconut and more walnuts I've got some
coconut sugar some melted coconut oil
and some berries now this coming year
fresh berries you can buy them at the
grocery store of course but they're not
going to be juicy they're not going to
be sweet and they're going to be four
times the price because they're just
really expensive because they're not in
season yet so whenever I come across
that I always like to buy my berries
frozen and in this particular case it
works so well because what happens is by
using the frozen berries it creates a
lot of juice which then soaks up into
the oatmeal and then it makes a lovely
almost like a sauce it's just so good so
what I've done is I've taken some just
some mixed berries mixed frozen berries
unthawed still frozen hear that and I
just put one layer in the bottom of my
small baking dish what I'm going to do
is my baking dish I'm actually replaced
it on a baking sheet that I've lined
with aluminum foil just in case any
spillage happens it catches it and your
oven doesn't get dirty and you get to go
speaking of oven I have mine preheated
to 350 we're good to go I'm just going
to take a big spoon and mix all of my
my ingredients together you can use any
milk you'd like you could use any
flavorings your heart desires but I
happen to really love this combination
and I think you will too
now to my milk I'm going to add my
sweetener which is maple syrup honey
works really great as well so whichever
you have my melted coconut oil and my
egg if you want to make this completely
vegan you absolutely can just you have
to do some flax seeds or facts meal and
some water like a mixture of the two you
can look it up and makes the substitute
for an egg and it works just as well I
just happened to have an eggs on hand
and I'll always have flax seeds on hand
so just got a good mix pour your wet
into your dry give everything a good mix
it looks like it's very soupy at this
point but you need all that liquid
because otherwise you're not going to
have enough liquid for your oats to cook
in and then what I do I can just pour
that right over the berries and I can't
get it all out of there I love oatmeal I
love big oatmeal regular oatmeal like
however you give it to me I am a fan so
this is just like perfection to me and
I'm very excited about it okay and then
all you do which is optional actually I
like to just top it with some more
flaked coconut and some almonds or some
long act today I'm going to use walnuts
you can even use pecans if you want to
in a little tiny bit of coconut sugar
just for a little more just a little
more sweetness and for a little more
hint of coconut the little coconut sugar
like a tablespoon not much and I'm just
going to pop this into my oven at 350
for 45 minutes to an hour or until the
center seems about set and I'll show you
what it looks like
my oatmeal baked for exactly an hour and
I've let it cool for I would say about
45 minutes or so you don't want to eat
it on a wall you can't eat it when it's
piping hot I prefer it from temperature
or even in cold with yogurt that's my
favorite way to eat it but room
temperature will do like it soaks up all
that gorgeous juicy very soft that it
creates because the bearings were frozen
I'm telling you do you need some yogurt
and like a little smidge of honey or
maple syrup on top and you'd be in
business it's so good it's unreal once
that will is buffing the berries have
beautiful flavor underneath it's an
all-around winner girl Laura in the
kitchen a complicated recipe I cannot
wait to have this for breakfast always
long with the recipe make it as we just
find time with me I think as a piece of
myself my own happiness time I
you
